description.para: Specifies which transports and ports the server should listen on for SMB traffic.
The order matters only for mDNS registrations, the first 'tcp' or 'nbt' port is used for that.
The transport 'tcp' uses raw tcp with a 4 byte length header per SMB PDU. The default port for 'tcp' is 445. Other ports can be specified by adding it after ':', e.g. 'tcp:1445'.
The transport 'nbt' uses netbios framing on top of tcp per SMB PDU. The default port for 'nbt' is 139. Other ports can be specified by adding it after ':', e.g. 'nbt:1139'.
Numerical ports are handled as 'tcp' except port '139' is handled as 'nbt'.
Note that's currently a limit of 10 unique transports, all others will be ignored.
